intro: Gonzalagunia whitei, commonly known as the White's gonzalagunia, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
